parameters: Fade out the screen and show the black bars for the cinematic effect.
Since we aren't using the player, we're going to need to halt
his movement and prevent menu opening, to do this we can simply
use a switch. Without this happening, the player can click to
move the player which will reveal the box-clicky thing
switch to stop movement and prevent opening menu
Change the blank events to mimick our party, set their location, and
make our current party hidden. Uncheck "wait for completion" in set movement
change screens tint and start a screen scroll, then fade in
First, we'll tint it all the way black to make the smooth
Now we fade in the screen to the desired color for 120 frames, or 2 seconds
Move the new party to the left, just before the baddy jumps down
and stops them. Uncheck wait for completion once again and estimate
or playtest to find out how many frames you'll need to wait before
the next action. We want harold to face Therese before she's done moving.
This can also be done in set move rout for harold, but either way works
For therese's last step, we're going to make her walk a bit
We start the dialogue. Make sure the window is transparent, and
you only use the 2 bottom lines of text. We're going to use show
picture to slide in the emotes
-- Start the picture at 734 x and 530 y
Slide it to 730 x and 530 y for about 20 frames, don't wait for
